title: Drawing, "Drawings. Sketches from Jamaica, West Indies", July 1865
medium: Graphite, brush and white gouache on heavy wove greenish, darkened to olive brown, paper
markings: Stamped in ink, at upper center: Lugt 457c
signed: Signed with three alternative monograms [see inscriptions]
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite at various locations, starting at top left:  2 pale yel / 3 yel / 4  3 green lines / 5 yel green / 6 green; again for the detail marked as "A", at top left:  2 white / 3 pale yel / 4 yel salmon; again, at center left: Bark reddish brown / with grey spots near root / all grey; again, at top right: maroon red / red / grey; and at bottom right: Jamaica / July '65 / two monograms FEC of different designs, a third unfinished alternative is drawn between them.
description: Vertical view containing various images:  the bough of a tree with a blossom which is shown again in a greater scale, at top left; boughs of a tree, one of them with leaves on the top, at center left; a bird in front of an outlined mountain, at top center; mountains, at center; a leaf plant, at top right; a stake fence and a bush, at center right; and at the bottom, distant view over mountains with a winding road on a ridge in the foreground, and three trees on a mountain top in the middle distance.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Drawings. Sketches from Jamaica, West Indies", July 1865.
July 1865. Graphite, brush and white gouache on heavy wove greenish, darkened to olive brown, paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-13.
